claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Christopher Allen Lloyd  (  born October 22 , 1938  )  is an American actor , voice actor and comedian best known for his roles as Emmett `` Doc '' Brown in the Back to the Future trilogy , Judge Doom in Who Framed Roger Rabbit  (  1988  )  , Merlock the Magician in DuckTales the Movie : Treasure of the Lost Lamp  (  1990  )  , Uncle Fester in The Addams Family  (  1991  )  and its sequel Addams Family Values  (  1993  )  , and Grigori Rasputin in Anastasia  (  1997  )  .

claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Lloyd has an equally prominent television profile , having won two Primetime Emmy Awards for playing Jim Ignatowski on the comedy series Taxi  (  1978 -- 1983  )  .

claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He earned a third Emmy for his 1992 guest appearance on Road to Avonlea .

claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He has also done extensive voiceover work for animated programs , most notably voicing The Hacker on the PBS Kids series Cyberchase  (  2002 -- 2015  )  .

claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The role earned him two Daytime Emmy Award nominations .

claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: PBS Kids is the brand for most of the children 's programming aired by the Public Broadcasting Service  (  PBS  )  in the United States .

claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Some public television children 's programs not produced by PBS member stations or transmitted by PBS which is produced by independent public television distributors such as American Public Television are not labeled as `` PBS Kids '' programming , and it is mainly a programming block branding .

claim: Christopher Lloyd reviewed for PBS Kids.
premise_source_doc_sentence: PBS Kids is also the name of a separate network which has had two iterations in the age of digital television ; one which existed between 1999 and 2005 , and the current version which was launched in January 2017 .
